title: dev server crashes with message 'Invalid state: ReadableStream is locked'
body:
### Describe the bug

Whenever I run code for my routes and an error occurs, the dev server crashes with the message `'Invalid state: ReadableStream is locked'`.

Here is the line that produces this error: https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/11950e00ac57919b09e6148b78004bbeb002a446/packages/kit/src/exports/node/index.js#L125

This is really annoying and stops me from beeing productive when I have to restart the server multiple times per hour or even per minute while experimenting with some concepts.

I can workaround the issue for now by replacing the line with
```ts
	let reader
	try {
		reader = response.body.getReader();
	} catch (e) {
		res.end();
		return;
	}
```

I would expect the dev server just to output an error e.g. "Not found: /foo" and not to chrash the whole server

### Reproduction

1. Start up a SvelteKit project.
2. Visit a route that does not exist (404 error).
3. You should see the dev server crash.
